subject: Re: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception?
msgSnippet: Also, this is better than the structure I originally proposed because it eliminates the need for a boolean flag. ...
messageBody:
Also, this is better than the structure I originally proposed because
it eliminates the need for a boolean flag.

--- Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...> wrote:
> > The Junit.org site has an FAQ section
> > (http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm) with the following
> > question: How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception?
> >
> > The answer they give is not completely correct because it does
> not
> > account for the possiblility that another exception could be
> thrown.
>
> I think they assume that your method only throws one exception. If
> your method throws more exceptions, you can use:
>
> // Test IllegalArgumentException is thrown when partnerID is null.
> public void test_00_isPartnerAssigned() {
> try {
> boolean assignedStatus =
> instancePartnerHierarchyWorker.isPartnerAssigned(null);
> } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
> return;
> } catch (Exception e) {
> fail("IllegalArgumentException should have been thrown.");
> }
> fail("IllegalArgumentException should have been thrown.");
> }
>
> -Vladimir
>
>
